selection_rationale: With a tiny client_fraction and heavy local computation, client drift and momentum-induced oscillations dominate. Reducing local_steps limits drift accumulation before aggregation; adjusting stepsize curbs overshoot during long local trajectories; tuning momentum (especially SFedAvg's projected momentum with r=1) manages the speed–stability trade-off, preventing amplified oscillations while retaining smoothing.

configs.rationale: Cut tau and eta to reduce drift/overshoot; moderate mu keeps smoothing without excessive accumulation under r=1.
Conservative stability-focused setting to minimize loss spikes and improve early accuracy ramp under extreme few-client selection.
Maintain relatively fast LR but sharply limit tau; slightly high mu to recover speed while avoiding long local momentum accumulation.
Baseline-like eta with short tau and reduced mu to test if stability can be achieved without sacrificing too much speed.
Slightly longer tau than the most conservative settings to probe the speed–drift trade-off with reduced eta and balanced mu.
Higher mu for acceleration paired with moderate tau and slightly smaller eta to keep oscillations in check.
Strong stability configuration to minimize divergence risk when aggregation is sparse; tests robustness at the cost of speed.
Keep high mu (baseline) but compensate with shorter tau and reduced eta to examine whether projected momentum can be stabilized for faster rounds.

expected_improvement: Relative to baseline (eta=0.15, tau=50, mu=0.95), we expect 30–50% lower max loss spikes, earlier attainment of 0.7 accuracy (rounds_to_0.7_acc reduced by ~20–40%), improved area_under_accuracy_curve_sfedavg by ~10–20%, and fewer rounds_to_target_loss_sfedavg (−20–40%). Stability should increase notably for SFedAvg under r=1 while maintaining or improving test accuracy.
